    public class TreeGraphFactory
extends GraphFactoryAdapter

                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> labels)

        Parameters:
        scopeName - the scope identifier, e.g. "MyTreeGraphFactory"
        labels - a map of (labels,class names) associating a label to the valid java class name of a descendant of TreeGraphNode or ALEdge

    • Method Detail

      • makeNode

        public TreeGraphNode makeNode​(java.lang.String proposedId)
        Description copied from interface: NodeFactory
        Create a node with no properties and a proposed ID. The class ID is set to the default (= the implementing class name). The proposed ID is checked for unicity within the scope of this factory, and if not, is modified appropriately to be unique. Therefore, the returned instance may have a unique ID different from the one proposed as an argument.
        Parameters:
        proposedId - the instance identifier
        Returns:
        the new Node instance

      • makeNode

        public TreeGraphNode makeNode​(java.lang.String proposedId,
                              ReadOnlyPropertyList props)
        Description copied from interface: NodeFactory
        Create a node with properties and a proposed ID. The class ID is set to the default (= the implementing class name). The proposed ID is checked for unicity within the scope of this factory, and if not, is modified appropriately to be unique. Therefore, the returned instance may have a unique ID different from the one proposed as an argument.
        Parameters:
        proposedId - the instance identifier
        props - properties
        Returns:
        the new Node instance

      • makeNode

        public TreeGraphNode makeNode​(java.lang.Class<? extends Node> nodeClass,
                              java.lang.String proposedId,
                              ReadOnlyPropertyList props)
        Description copied from interface: NodeFactory
        Create a node of a particular sub-class with properties and a proposed ID. The class ID is set to the implementing class name or, if recorded in this factory, to its label. The proposed ID is checked for unicity within the scope of this factory, and if not, is modified appropriately to be unique. Therefore, the returned instance may have a unique ID different from the one proposed as an argument.
        Parameters:
        nodeClass - the Node implementation to use to create this instance
        proposedId - the instance identifier
        props - properties
        Returns:
        the new Node instance, null if construction failed

      • makeNode

        public TreeGraphNode makeNode​(java.lang.Class<? extends Node> nodeClass,
                              java.lang.String proposedId)
        Description copied from interface: NodeFactory
        Create a node of a particular sub-class with no properties and a proposed ID. The class ID is set to the implementing class name or, if recorded in this factory, to its label. The proposed ID is checked for unicity within the scope of this factory, and if not, is modified appropriately to be unique. Therefore, the returned instance may have a unique ID different from the one proposed as an argument.
        Parameters:
        nodeClass - the Node implementation to use to create this instance
        proposedId - the instance identifier
        Returns:
        the new Node instance, null if construction failed

      • manageGraph

        public void manageGraph​(NodeSet<? extends Node> graph)
        Description copied from interface: NodeFactory
        Associate a graph instance to this factory. Further instances created by calls to one of the makeNode(...) methods will be added into this graph.
        Parameters:
        graph - the Graph or Tree instance to manage

      • unmanageGraph

        public void unmanageGraph​(NodeSet<? extends Node> graph)
        Description copied from interface: NodeFactory
        Dissociate a graph instance from this factory. Further instances created by calls to one of the makeNode(...) methods will no more be added into this graph.
        Parameters:
        graph - the Graph or Tree instance to manage
